answers.answer: HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!Well, if the levels are marginally low, then no cause of worry. Repeat test after a month and see. However if the levels are too low, then yes, you should worry. Low albumin can be the result of malabsorption syndromes, Celiac disease, chronic hepatitris B or C, non alcoholic hepatitis, hemochromatosis, Wilson’s disease, autoimmune hepatitis, and alpha 1 antitrypsin enzyme deficiency. Hence all tests to rule these out should be done. It would be good to consult a hepatologist. Increased urinary loss as in kidney problems or due to diabetes can also be investigated.Please consult your PCP for primary examination followed by proper referral. Hope this helps. Take care!

question: i have just recieved routine blood test results and been told that my blood albumin level is low, but not to worry!!!!! Should i worry
title: liver albumin levels
